data.text: Is the file malicious (e.g., malware)?
data.label: Q1: File malicious? [5]

data.text: Was the malicious file delivered via a phishing email?
data.label: Q2: Delivered via email? [4]

data.text: Did the user open the email attachment?
data.label: Q3: Open attachment? [4]

data.text: Did the malicious file execute on the host system?
data.label: Q4: File executed on host? [5]

data.text: Was the file downloaded from the internet or an external source?
data.label: Q5: Downloaded from internet? [4]

data.text: Did the user execute/run the file downloaded from the internet?
data.label: Q6: Ran downloaded file? [4]

data.text: Was the file introduced via a USB or other removable media?
data.label: Q7: Via USB media? [3]

data.text: Did the user run the file from the removable media device?
data.label: Q8: Ran from USB? [3]

data.text: Was the file created on the host by another process (possible malware)?
data.label: Q9: File dropped by malware? [4]

data.text: Is the host system compromised?
data.label: Q10: Host compromised? [5]

data.text: Is there a suspicious email that could be part of this incident?
data.label: Q11: Suspicious email present? [5]

data.text: Does the email contain a malicious attachment?
data.label: Q12: Malicious attachment? [4]

data.text: Does the email contain suspicious links?
data.label: Q13: Suspicious links? [4]

data.text: Did the user click on the suspicious email link?
data.label: Q14: User clicked link? [5]

data.text: Did the suspicious link lead to a credential phishing page?
data.label: Q15: Link led to phishing page? [4]

data.text: Is the user's account compromised?
data.label: Q16: User account compromised? [5]

data.text: Did the link deliver malware to the host?
data.label: Q17: Link delivered malware? [4]

data.text: Are there suspicious processes running on the host?
data.label: Q18: Suspicious processes on host? [4]

data.text: Were any known malware processes or suspicious executables found on the host?
data.label: Q19: Malware process found? [4]

data.text: Is there evidence of persistence on the host (e.g., autorun entries)?
data.label: Q20: Host persistence evidence? [4]

data.text: Were any unusual autorun entries or startup tasks found on the host?
data.label: Q21: Suspicious autoruns? [3]

data.text: Were any new services or scheduled tasks created on the host?
data.label: Q22: New services or tasks? [3]

data.text: Were any system event logs on the host cleared or tampered with?
data.label: Q23: Host logs cleared? [3]

data.text: Did the host connect to any known malicious IP addresses or domains?
data.label: Q24: Connections to malicious hosts? [4]

data.text: Is there evidence of data exfiltration from the network?
data.label: Q25: Data exfiltration observed? [5]

data.text: Were there unusually large or frequent data transfers out of the network?
data.label: Q26: Large outbound data transfers? [4]

data.text: Did the attacker attempt lateral movement from this host?
data.label: Q27: Lateral movement attempted? [4]

data.text: Were any remote administration tools (e.g., PsExec) used on the host?
data.label: Q28: Remote tools used? [3]

data.text: Have other hosts in the network shown signs of compromise?
data.label: Q29: Other hosts compromised? [5]

data.text: Were any user credentials (passwords or hashes) harvested from the host?
data.label: Q30: Credentials harvested on host? [4]

data.text: Did the attacker obtain any high-privilege credentials (e.g., domain admin)?
data.label: Q31: High-privilege creds obtained? [5]

data.text: Did the attacker use any stolen credentials to access other systems or services?
data.label: Q32: Stolen creds used elsewhere? [5]

data.text: Did the attacker use stolen credentials to access cloud resources?
data.label: Q33: Stolen creds used in cloud? [4]

data.text: Did the attacker use stolen credentials to access any corporate applications?
data.label: Q34: Stolen creds used in apps? [4]

data.text: Did the attacker escalate privileges on the host (e.g., to admin/root)?
data.label: Q35: Privilege escalation on host? [4]

data.text: Is the cloud infrastructure environment compromised?
data.label: Q36: Cloud environment compromised? [5]

data.text: Were any new accounts or keys created in the cloud environment?
data.label: Q37: New cloud accounts/keys? [4]

data.text: Were there any unusual or suspicious cloud API calls or actions?
data.label: Q38: Suspicious cloud API calls? [4]

data.text: Were cloud logging or security configurations altered?
data.label: Q39: Cloud logging/security tampered? [3]

data.text: Were any unexpected cloud resources (instances, services) created or modified?
data.label: Q40: Unexpected cloud resources? [3]

data.text: Did the attacker access any sensitive data in the cloud environment?
data.label: Q41: Sensitive cloud data accessed? [5]

data.text: Were any cloud storage buckets or resources shared externally?
data.label: Q42: Cloud storage shared externally? [4]

data.text: Was data exfiltrated from the cloud environment?
data.label: Q43: Data exfiltrated from cloud? [4]

data.text: Did the attacker attempt to pivot from the cloud environment to other targets?
data.label: Q44: Pivot from cloud to other targets? [3]

data.text: Was an email or user account taken over (possible Business Email Compromise)?
data.label: Q45: Account takeover (BEC)? [5]

data.text: Did the attacker set up any unauthorized email forwarding rules?
data.label: Q46: Malicious forwarding rules? [4]

data.text: Did the attacker access or tamper with sensitive emails or data in the mailbox?
data.label: Q47: Mailbox data accessed? [4]

data.text: Did the attacker change the account's password or other credentials?
data.label: Q48: Account password changed? [3]

data.text: Were any other user accounts compromised as part of this incident?
data.label: Q49: Other accounts compromised? [3]

data.text: Did the attacker attempt to access other services with the compromised account?
data.label: Q50: Used account on other services? [4]

data.text: Is an application or service (e.g., web app) compromised via an exploit?
data.label: Q51: Application compromised via exploit? [5]

data.text: Did the attacker install a web shell or malicious code in the application?
data.label: Q52: Web shell installed? [4]

data.text: Did the attacker access sensitive data through the application?
data.label: Q53: Sensitive data accessed via app? [5]

data.text: Were there any suspicious administrative actions in the application?
data.label: Q54: Suspicious admin actions in app? [3]

data.text: Were there any error messages or crashes that indicate a possible exploit?
data.label: Q55: Errors indicating exploit? [2]

data.text: Do application logs show any malicious activity or injections?
data.label: Q56: Malicious activity in app logs? [4]

data.text: Were there any bulk data downloads or exports from the application?
data.label: Q57: Bulk data downloads from app? [4]

data.text: Were any files or records in the application altered or deleted?
data.label: Q58: Records altered in app? [3]

data.text: Did the attacker create any new user accounts or roles in the application?
data.label: Q59: New accounts in application? [3]

data.text: Were any API keys or tokens in the application stolen or misused?
data.label: Q60: API tokens stolen? [3]

data.text: Was the file created or modified recently (within the incident timeframe)?
data.label: Q61: File created recently? [2]

data.text: Does the file have known malware signatures or indicators?
data.label: Q62: Known malicious indicators? [3]

data.text: Is the file's type or extension suspicious or mismatched?
data.label: Q63: File extension mismatched? [2]

data.text: Were any internal network scans or reconnaissance activities detected?
data.label: Q64: Internal scanning detected? [3]

data.text: Were there any remote access connections from unusual locations (e.g., VPN, RDP)?
data.label: Q65: Unusual remote access? [4]

data.text: Were any DNS queries made to known malicious domains?
data.label: Q66: DNS queries to malicious domains? [2]

data.text: Were large data uploads to external services or websites observed?
data.label: Q67: Large uploads to external sites? [3]

data.text: Is there evidence of cryptomining or illicit use of cloud resources?
data.label: Q68: Cryptomining in cloud? [2]

data.text: Did the attacker use compromised cloud resources to attack other systems?
data.label: Q69: Cloud resources used for attack? [3]

data.text: Is there evidence of cryptomining malware on the host?
data.label: Q70: Cryptomining malware on host? [2]

data.text: Did the attacker install any backdoors or malicious tools on the host?
data.label: Q71: Backdoors installed on host? [3]

data.text: Did the attacker access or collect sensitive data on the host?
data.label: Q72: Sensitive data collected on host? [3]

data.text: Did the attacker use any removable media (USB) to exfiltrate data?
data.label: Q73: Data exfil via USB? [2]

data.text: Did the attacker deploy ransomware or other destructive malware on the host?
data.label: Q74: Ransomware deployed? [5]

data.text: Did the attacker exfiltrate data via email (e.g., sending out attachments)?
data.label: Q75: Data exfil via email? [2]

data.text: Did the attacker use any anti-forensic tools or techniques on the host?
data.label: Q76: Anti-forensic tools used? [3]
